Title: Push notification system to mobile game player using distributed event-based system approach
Source title: Proceeding - 2016 2nd International Conference on Science in Information Technology, ICSITech 2016: Information Science for Green Society and Environment
Affiliations: Computer Science, Binus Graduate Program, Bina, Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Yunisa, F., Computer Science, Binus Graduate Program, Bina, Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Suharijto, Computer Science, Binus Graduate Program, Bina, Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: Push notification is a mechanism that allows individuals to receive updated information quickly. Push notification delivery needs to be effectived and has to be paid attention to time zone differences between countries in order to generate time-appropriate notifications. This push notification system was developed using distributed event-based system approach. The research methodology consists of four stages: initial research, data collection and processing, system development, and evaluation. The result of this research is a scalable web-based push notification system supported by the usage of scheduler and consumer that can help the company send notifications about game updates easier and quicker to millions of mobile devices. © 2016 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Distributed event-based system; Game player; Push Notification
Index Keywords: Data handling; Data collection; Distributed event-based systems; Game players; Notification systems; Push Notification; Research methodologies; System development; Updated informations; Software architecture
